text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Sharqia Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Flag Of Sharkia Governorate.png | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of Sharqia Govenorate.JPG | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Sharqia in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Sharqia Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Zagazig (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 4,180 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 8017894 | population_as_of = December 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Sharqia Governorate is a governorate in Egypt. The capital city is Zagazig. ==Cities== The following cities are in Sharqia Governorate: *10th of Ramadan *Abu Hammad *Abu Kebir *Awlad Saqr *Bilbeis *Diyarb Negm *El Husseiniya *El Ibrahimiya *El Qurein *Faqous *Hihya *Kafr Saqr *Mashtool El Souk *Minya El Qamh *El Salheya El Gedida ==Notable people== Some notable people who were born, or lived, in Sharqia are: * Mohamed Morsi, former President of Egypt * Ahmed Shafik, former Prime Minister of Egypt * Ahmed Subhy Mansour, founder of the Quranist movement * Abdel Halim Hafez, popular singer and actor * Miral al-Tahawy, award-winning Bedouin novelist * Ahmed 'Urabi, the leader of the 1881 nationalist uprising against the British * Hamada Helal, Egyptian singer * Emad Moteab, Egptian footballer ==References== Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Sharqia Governorate
